	&#160;

	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	The aggregate market value of the Common Stock held by non-affiliates of the registrant as of December 31, 2015 was approximately $57 million (computed using the closing price of $8.17&#160;per share of Common Stock on December 31, 2015, as reported by the NASDAQ Global Market).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	As of March 15, 2016, Firsthand Technology Value Fund had 7,702,705 shares of common stock, par value $0.001&#160;per share, outstanding.
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 11PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 1PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #555555; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #555555" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage2"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<IMG STYLE="HEIGHT: 856PX; WIDTH: 750PX" BORDER="0" ALT="(FRONT COVER)" SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/03/15/0001398344-16-011039_FP0018563_01.JPG">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 11PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 1PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #555555; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #555555" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage3"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	DEAR FELLOW SHAREHOLDERS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	A year ago in this space I discussed the profitable exits from Facebook&#160; and Twitter that SVVC achieved in 2014. By comparison, 2015 was relatively quiet. I&#8217;m disappointed to report that the Fund&#8217;s net asset value declined by 6.94% during the year, accompanied by a steep (56.19%) decline in our market price. See pages 40-50 of the Annual Report for the Fund&#8217;s detailed financial information.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	While two of our companies, Sunrun and Pure Storage, completed IPOs during the year, our pre-IPO shares were subject to a lock-up throughout 2015. For SVVC, 2015 is perhaps best described as a re-loading year, as we re-deployed the capital that came back into the Fund as a result of the liquidation of our Facebook and Twitter investments.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	A SPARK FROM LATE-STAGE COMPANIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	As a result of our Facebook and Twitter exits in late 2014, the portfolio had less exposure to late-stage private companies in early 2015 than we were comfortable with. Generally, we strive to maintain a diversified portfolio of early-, middle-, and late-stage companies in order to achieve exits on a consistent basis. In order to increase our exposure to late-stage companies, we made new investments in Cloudera, Nutanix, Pure Storage, and Roku during 2015. In addition to the Sunrun&#160; and Pure Storage IPOs already mentioned, Nutanix has filed its Form S-1 in preparation to go public.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Roku&#8217;s video streaming devices continue to lead the market in the United States. Research firm Park Associates reported during the year that Roku was not only the best-selling video streaming device in the U.S., but the most-used device in the category as well. More recently, Roku announced that more than one million Roku-powered smart TVs have been sold in the U.S. since entering the market in 2014. The company recently completed another round of private funding, which we hope will set the stage for an IPO in the not-too-distant future.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Mattson Technologies announced late in the year that it has entered into a definitive agreement to merge with Beijing E-town Dragon Semiconductor Industry Investment Center (&#8220;E-town Dragon&#8221;). Under the agreement, E-town Dragon will acquire all of the outstanding shares of Mattson for $3.80 per share in cash. The transaction is subject to approval by Mattson&#8217;s stockholders, and is expected to close in the first quarter of 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Some of our late-stage companies struggled during the year as well. Since going public in August 2015, Sunrun has experienced dramatic volatility in its stock, trading in a range from $6.36 to $14.95 per share in its first 6 months as a public company. Although the company&#8217;s installations and revenues continue to grow at a healthy pace, uncertainty surrounding both energy costs and the regulatory environment continue to haunt the stock.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Pure Storage has also had a rough ride in the stock market since going public in October 2015. After a lackluster IPO, in which the stock closed below its IPO price on its first day of trading, the company&#8217;s stock recovered after Dell&#8217;s acquisition of EMC was announced. Later, it suffered following an earnings miss by competitor Nimble Storage, before bouncing back with Pure Storage&#8217;s earnings beat.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Finally, it has been reported that Jawbone (a.k.a., Aliphcom) laid off 15% of its workforce in Q4 2015. In an increasingly crowded wearables market, Jawbone appears to be struggling to keep pace with competitors including Fitbit, Garmin, and Apple.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	MILESTONES FOR MIDDLE-STAGE COMPANIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	A number of our middle-stage companies achieved public recognition in 2015. Pivotal Systems and Phunware were both named to Red Herring&#8217;s list of the Top 100 private companies in North America in June. Pivotal was later named one of Inc. Magazine&#8217;s Top 500 fastest-growing private companies, posting three-year revenue growth of 1,522%.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Advertising technology company Tapad continued to report significant growth. Annual revenue increased 70% in 2015 and the company announced during the year that revenues for its cross-device video business had grown 300% year-over-year, and now make up 20% of Tapad&#8217;s total revenues. In the fourth quarter alone, the company&#8217;s video revenues grew 91% on a quarter-over-quarter basis. We are pleased to report that in February 2016, Tapad announced that it is being acquired by Norwegian telecom company Telenor for $360 million in cash. As I write this, we anticipate a healthy realized gain if this proposed transaction closes on the announced terms.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	After a management change and aggressive cost-cutting efforts in 2014, Hightail has reported that it is now profitable. New CEO (and co-founder) Ranjith Kumaran led the company away from the commodity file-sharing market inhabited by Box, Dropbox, Amazon, and Google. Instead, Kumaran has re-focused the company on the creative professional market segment, and its latest service offering, Hightail Spaces, reflects that focus. The goal of Hightail Spaces is to replace e-mail as the collaboration app of choice for visual files.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	CONTINUED ON INSIDE BACK COVER
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 11PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 1PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #555555; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #555555" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage4"></A>
</DIV>

	DOCUMENTS INCORPORATED BY REFERENCE
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">

</DIV>

</DIV>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 80.03%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #DCDCDC">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Selected Financial Data
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 4.99%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #DCDCDC">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">

We use words such as &#8220;anticipates,&#8221; &#8220;believes,&#8221; &#8220;expects,&#8221; &#8220;plans,&#8221; &#8220;will,&#8221; &#8220;may,&#8221; &#8220;continues,&#8221; &#8220;believes,&#8221; &#8220;seeks,&#8221; &#8220;likely,&#8221; &#8220;intends,&#8221; and similar expressions to identify forward-looking statements. </DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Our actual results could differ materially from those projected in the forward-looking statements for any reason, including the factors set forth in &#8220;Risk Factors&#8221; and elsewhere in this Annual Report on Form 10-K.&#160; In addition, several factors that could materially affect our actual results are the ability of the portfolio companies in which we invest to achieve their objectives; our ability to source favorable private investments; changes in the securities markets, especially the markets for technology companies including those that may be early stage or micro-cap companies; the dependence of our future success of the general economy and its impact on the industries in which we invest and other factors discussed in our periodic filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the &#8220;SEC&#8221;).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Unpredictable or unknown factors could also have material adverse effects on us. Since our actual results, performance or achievements could differ materially from those expressed in, or implied by, these forward-looking statements, we cannot give any assurance that any of the events anticipated by the forward-looking statements will occur, or, if any of them do, what impact they will have on our results of operations and financial condition. All forward-looking statements included in this Annual Report on Form 10-K are expressly qualified in their entirety by the foregoing cautionary statements. You are cautioned not to place undue reliance on these forward-looking statements, which speak only as of the date hereof
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	We do not undertake any obligation to update, amend or clarify these forward-looking statements or the risk factors contained in this Annual Report on Form 10-K, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise, except as may be required under the federal securities laws. Although we undertake no obligation to revise or update any forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise, you are advised to consult any additional disclosures that we may make directly to you or through reports that we in the future may file with the SEC.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	GENERAL
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Firsthand Technology Value Fund, Inc. (&#8220;we,&#8221; &#8220;us,&#8221; &#8220;our,&#8221; the &#8220;Company&#8221; or &#8220;SVVC&#8221;) is an externally managed, closed-end, non-diversified management investment company organized as a Maryland corporation that has elected to be treated as a business development company (&#8220;BDC&#8221;) under the Investment Company Act of 1940 (the &#8220;1940 Act&#8221;). As such, we are required to comply with certain regulatory requirements. For instance, we generally have to invest at least 70 percent of our total assets in &#8220;qualifying assets,&#8221; including securities of private or micro-cap public U.S. companies, cash, cash equivalents, U.S. government securities and high-quality debt investments that mature in one year or less. In addition, for tax purposes we have elected to be treated as a regulated investment company, or RIC, under Subchapter M of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, which we refer to as the &#8220;Code.&#8221; Firsthand Capital Management, Inc. (the &#8220;Investment Adviser&#8221;, the &#8220;Adviser&#8221;, or &#8220;FCM&#8221;) serves as our investment adviser and manages the investment process on a daily basis.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 11PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	4
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 1PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #555555; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #555555" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	We were incorporated under the Maryland General Corporation Law in April 2010 and acquired our initial portfolio of securities through the reorganization (the &#8220;Reorganization&#8221;) into us of Firsthand Technology Value Fund (&#8220;TVF&#8221;), an open-end mutual fund and a series of Firsthand Funds, which is a Delaware statutory trust. The reorganization was completed on April 15, 2011 and we commenced operations on April 18, 2011.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Our investment objective is to seek long-term growth of capital, principally by seeking capital gains on our equity and equityrelated investments. There can be no assurance that we will achieve our investment objective. Under normal circumstances, we invest at least 80 percent of our total assets for investment purposes in technology companies. We consider technology companies to be those companies that derive at least 50 percent of their revenues from products and/or services within the information technology sector and in the &#8220;cleantech&#8221; sector
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Information technology companies include, but are not limited to, those focused on computer hardware, software, telecommunications, networking, Internet, and consumer electronics. While there is no standard definition of cleantech, it is generally regarded as including goods and services designed to harness renewable energy and materials, eliminate emissions and waste, and reduce the use of natural resources. In addition, under normal circumstances we invest at least 70 percent of our assets in privately held companies and public companies with market capitalizations less than $250 million. Our portfolio is primarily composed of equity and equity derivative securities of technology and cleantech companies (as defined above). These investments generally range between $1 million and $10 million each, although the investment size will vary proportionately with the size of our capital base. We acquire our investments through direct investments in private companies, negotiations with selling shareholders, and in organized secondary marketplaces for private securities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	While our primary focus is to invest in illiquid private technology and cleantech companies, we may also invest in micro-cap publicly traded companies. In addition, we may invest up to 30% of the portfolio in opportunistic investments that do not constitute the private companies and micro-cap public companies described above. These other investments may include investments in securities of public companies that are actively traded. These other investments may also include investments in high-yield bonds, distressed debt, or securities of public companies that are actively traded; and securities of companies located outside of the United States. Our investment activities are managed by FCM.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Neither our investments nor an investment in us are intended to constitute a balanced investment program. We expect to be risk-seeking rather than risk-averse in our investment approach. There is no assurance that our investment objective will be achieved.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	We invest a substantial portion of our assets in securities that we consider to be private venture capital equity investments. These private venture capital equity investments usually do not pay interest or dividends and usually are subject to legal or contractual restrictions on resale that may adversely affect the liquidity and marketability of such securities. We expect to make speculative venture capital investments with limited marketability and a greater risk of investment loss than less-speculative investments. Subject to the diversification requirements applicable to a regulated investment company (&#8220;RIC&#8221;), we may commit all of our assets to only a few investments.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Subject to continuing to meet the compliance tests applicable to BDCs, there are no limitations on the types of securities or other assets in which we may invest. Investments may include the following:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>

</SUP>
</DIV>

	Fair value for our private company holdings was determined in good faith by our board of directors on December 31, 2015. For public companies, the figure represents the market value of our securities on December 31, 2015, less any discount due to resale restriction on the security
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV>
<TABLE ID="2581A2E4AC734E2FBE546DBEA2D48494" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-SIZE: SMALLER; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	2
</SUP>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Public company
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	INVESTMENTS AND STRATEGIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	The following is a summary description of the types of assets in which we may invest, the investment strategies we may use, and the attendant risks associated with our investments and strategies.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	VENTURE CAPITAL INVESTMENTS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	We define venture capital as the money and resources made available to privately held start-up firms and privately held and publicly traded small businesses with exceptional growth potential. These businesses can range in stage from pre-revenue to generating positive cash flow
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Most of our long-term venture capital investments are in thinly capitalized, unproven, small companies focused on commercializing risky technologies. These businesses also tend to lack management depth, have limited or no history of operations, and have not attained profitability
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Because of the speculative nature of these investments, these securities have a significantly greater risk of loss than traditional investment securities. Some of our venture capital investments will never realize their potential, and some will be unprofitable or result in the complete loss of our investment.
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 11PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	6
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 1PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #555555; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #555555" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage9"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	We acquire our investments through direct investments in private companies, negotiations with selling shareholders, and in organized secondary marketplaces for private securities. Our current focus is on investing in late-stage private companies, particularly those with potential for near-term realizations by way of IPO or acquisition.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	In connection with our venture capital investments, we may participate in providing a variety of services to our portfolio companies, including the following:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="17612E24494846FC8AFCECD984439765" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#8226;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Recruiting
</FONT>
	management,
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="29A35FB48F1541DE9FBC636E6CE6AE9F" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT: 15PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#8226;
</DIV>
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Formulating operating strategies,
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="0E816C8CBE2E423A9127620E2FDD3BF0" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>

	Formulating intellectual property strategies,

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="ACBBD43309C243E797AD1D6242EB8A92" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#8226;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Assisting
</FONT>
	&#160;in financial planning,
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="61D0803DBCF5497C8CAA47C2E90243AC" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#8226;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Providing management in the initial start-up stages, and
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="85FB05F4AF1B4807BB1BE299CB35A337" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#8226;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Establishing corporate goals.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	We may assist in raising additional capital for these companies from other potential investors and may subordinate our own investment to that of other investors. We typically find it necessary or appropriate to provide additional capital of our own. We may introduce these companies to potential joint venture partners, suppliers, and customers. In addition, we may assist in establishing relationships with investment bankers and other professionals. We may also assist with mergers and acquisitions (&#8220;M&amp;As&#8221;). We do not currently derive income from these companies for the performance of any of the above services.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	We may control, be represented on, or have observer rights on the Board of Directors of a portfolio company through one or more of our officers or directors, who may also serve as officers of the portfolio company
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	We indemnify our officers and directors for serving on the Boards of Directors or as officers of portfolio companies, which exposes us to additional risks. Particularly during the early stages of an investment, we may, in rare instances, in effect be conducting the operations of the portfolio company. Our goal is to assist each company in establishing its own independent capitalization, management, and Board of Directors. As a venture capital-backed company emerges from the developmental stage with greater management depth and experience, we expect that our role in the portfolio company&#8217;s operations will diminish.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	EQUITY
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	EQUITY-RELATED SECURITIES AND DEBT WITH EQUITY FEATURES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	We may invest in equity, equity-related securities, and debt with equity features. These securities include common stock, preferred stock, debt instruments convertible into common or preferred stock, limited partnership interests, other beneficial ownership interests and warrants, options, or other rights to acquire any of the foregoing.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	We may make investments in companies with operating histories that are unprofitable or marginally profitable, that have negative net worth, or that are involved in bankruptcy or reorganization proceedings. These investments would involve businesses that management believes have potential through the infusion of additional capital and management assistance. In addition, we may make investments in connection with the acquisition or divestiture of companies or divisions of companies. There is a significantly greater risk of loss with these types of securities than is the case with traditional investment securities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Warrants, options, and convertible or exchangeable securities generally give the investor the right to acquire specified equity securities of an issuer at a specified price during a specified period or on a specified date. Warrants and options fluctuate in value in relation to the value of the underlying security and the remaining life of the warrant or option, while convertible or exchangeable securities fluctuate in value both in relation to the intrinsic value of the security without the conversion or exchange feature and in relation to the value of the conversion or exchange feature, which is like a warrant or an option. When we invest in these securities, we incur the risk that the option feature will expire worthless, thereby either eliminating or diminishing the value of our investment.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Most of our current portfolio company investments are in the equity securities of private companies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Investments in equity securities of private companies often involve securities that are restricted as to sale and cannot be sold in the open market without registration under the Securities Act of 1933 or pursuant to a specific exemption from these registrations
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Opportunities for sale are more limited than in the case of marketable securities
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	although these investments may be purchased at more advantageous prices and may offer attractive investment opportunities
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Even if one of our portfolio companies completes an IPO
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	we are typically subject to a lock-up agreement for 18
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	0
</FONT>
	days
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	and the stock price may decline substantially before we are free to sell.
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 11PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	7
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 1PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #555555; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #555555" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage10"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	We may also invest in publicly traded securities of whatever nature, including relatively small, emerging growth companies that management believes have long-term growth potential. These investments may be through open-market transactions or through private placements in publicly traded companies (&#8220;PIPEs&#8221;). Securities purchased in PIPE transactions are typically subject to a lock-up agreement for 180 days, or are issued as unregistered securities that are not freely available for six months.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Even if we have registration rights to make our investments in privately held and publicly traded companies more marketable, a considerable amount of time may elapse between a decision to sell or register the securities for sale and the time when we are able to sell the securities. The prices obtainable upon sale may be adversely affected by market conditions or negative conditions affecting the issuer during the intervening time. We may elect to hold formerly restricted securities after they have become freely marketable, either because they remain relatively illiquid or because we believe that they may appreciate in value, during which holding period they may decline in value and be especially volatile as unseasoned securities. If we need funds for investment or working capital purposes, we might need to sell marketable securities at disadvantageous times or prices.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	DEBT OBLIGATIONS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	We may hold debt securities
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	including in privately held and thinly traded public companies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	for income and as a reserve pending more speculative investments
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Debt obligations may include U.S
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	government and agency securities
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	commercial paper
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	bankers&#8217; acceptances
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	receivables or other asset-based financing
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	notes
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	bonds
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	debentures
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	or other debt obligations of any nature and repurchase agreements related to these securities
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	These obligations may have varying terms with respect to security or credit support; subordination; purchase price; interest payments; and maturity from private
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	public
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	or governmental issuers of any type located anywhere in the world
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	We may invest in debt obligations of companies with operating histories that are unprofitable or marginally profitable, that have negative net worth or are involved in bankruptcy or reorganization proceedings
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	or that are start-up or development-stage entities
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	In addition
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	we may participate in the acquisition or divestiture of companies or divisions of companies through issuance or receipt of debt obligations
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	As of December 31
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	2015
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	the debt obligations held in our portfolio consisted of convertible bridge notes and term notes
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	The convertible bridge notes generally do not generate cash payments to us
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	nor are they held for that purpose
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Our convertible bridge notes and the interest accrued thereon are held for the purpose of potential conversion into equity at a future date. The term notes we hold are income generating.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Our investments in debt obligations may be of varying quality
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	including non-rated
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	unsecured
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	highly speculative debt investments with limited marketability
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Investments in lower-rated and non-rated securities
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	commonly referred to as &#8220;junk bonds,&#8221; including our venture debt investments
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	are subject to special risks
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	including a greater risk of loss of principal and non-payment of interest
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Generally
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	lower-rated securities offer a higher return potential than higher-rated securities
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	but involve greater volatility of price and greater risk of loss of income and principal
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	including the possibility of default or bankruptcy of the issuers of these securities
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Lower-rated securities and comparable non-rated securities will likely have large uncertainties or major risk exposure to adverse conditions and are predominantly speculative with respect to the issuer&#8217;s capacity to pay interest and repay principal in accordance with the terms of the obligation
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	The occurrence of adverse conditions and uncertainties to issuers of lower-rated securities would likely reduce the value of lower-rated securities held by us
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	with a commensurate effect on the value of our shares.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	The markets in which lower-rated securities or comparable non-rated securities are traded generally are more limited than those in which higher-rated securities are traded
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	The existence of limited markets for these securities may restrict our ability to obtain accurate market quotations for the purposes of valuing lower-rated or non-rated securities and calculating net asset value or to sell securities at their fair value
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Any economic downturn could adversely affect the ability of issuers&#8217; lower-rated securities to repay principal and pay interest thereon
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	The market values of lower-rated and non-rated securities also tend to be more sensitive to individual corporate developments and changes in economic conditions than higher-rated securities
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	In addition
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	lower-rated securities and comparable non-rated securities generally present a higher degree of credit risk
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Issuers of lower-rated securities and comparable non-rated securities are often highly leveraged and may not have more traditional methods of financing available to them
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	so that their ability to service their debt obligations during an economic downturn or during sustained periods of rising interest rates may be impaired
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	The risk of loss owing to default by these issuers is significantly greater because lower-rated securities and comparable non-rated securities generally are unsecured and frequently are subordinated to the prior payment of senior indebtedness
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	We may incur additional expenses to the extent that we are required to seek recovery upon a default in the payment of principal or interest on our portfolio holdings.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	The market value of investments in debt securities that carry no equity participation usually reflects yields generally available on securities of similar quality and type at the time purchased
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	When interest rates decline
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	the market value of a debt portfolio already invested at higher yields can be expected to rise if the securities are protected against early call
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Similarly
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	when interest rates increase, the market value of a debt portfolio already invested at lower yields can be expected to decline
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Deterioration in credit quality also generally causes a decline in market value of the security
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	while an improvement in credit quality generally leads to increased value.
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 11PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	8
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 1PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #555555; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #555555" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage11"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	FOREIGN SECURITIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	We may make investments in securities of issuers whose principal operations are conducted outside the United States, and whose earnings and securities are stated in foreign currency. In order to maintain our status as a BDC, our investments in non-qualifying assets, including the securities of companies organized outside the U.S., would be limited to 30 percent of our assets, because we must invest at least 70 percent of our assets in &#8220;qualifying assets,&#8221; and securities of foreign companies are not &#8220;qualifying assets.&#8221;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Compared to otherwise comparable investments in securities of U.S
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	issuers
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	currency exchange risk of securities of foreign issuers is a significant variable
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	The value of these investments to us will vary with the relation of the currency in which they are denominated to the U.S
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	dollar
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	as well as with intrinsic elements of value such as credit risk
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	interest rates
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	and performance of the issuer
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Investments in foreign securities also involve risks relating to economic and political developments
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	including nationalization
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	expropriation of assets
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	currency exchange freezes
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	and local recession
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Securities of many foreign issuers are less liquid and more volatile than those of comparable U.S
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	issuers
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Interest and dividend income and capital gains on our foreign securities may be subject to withholding and other taxes that may not be recoverable by us
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	We may seek to hedge all or part of the currency risk of our investments in foreign securities through the use of futures
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	options
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	and forward currency purchases or sales.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	We believe there is a role for organizations that can assist in technology transfer. Scientists and institutions that develop and patent intellectual property perceive the need for and rewards of entrepreneurial commercialization of their inventions. Our form of investment may be:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="C3992D800DE54D5E95E40AC28CFB158C" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#8226;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Funding research and development in the development of a technology
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="35EC152CE09D4FC08AA6D001732835DD" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	&#8226;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Obtaining&#160;licensing rights to intellectual property or patents,
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="FF6D2406612F4974BFFFF25BE280C518" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#8226;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Acquiring&#160;intellectual property or patents, or
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="472151F244DA44C68F8FE788C964D4F3" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
