<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 11PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	53
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 1PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #555555; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #555555" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage57"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Firsthand Technology Value Fund, Inc.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Notes to Financial Statements - continued
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	DECEMBER 31, 2015
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	NOTE 3. BUSINESS RISKS AND UNCERTAINTIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	We plan to invest a substantial portion of our assets in privately-held companies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	the securities of which are inherently illiquid
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	We also seek to invest in small publicly-traded companies that we believe have exceptional growth potential and to make opportunistic investments in publicly-traded companies
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	both large and small
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	In the case of investments in small publicly-traded companies, although these companies are publicly traded
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	their stock may not trade at high volumes
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	and prices can be volatile
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	which may restrict our ability to sell our positions
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	These privately held and publicly traded businesses tend to lack management depth
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	have limited or no history of operations and typically have not attained profitability
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Because of the speculative nature of our investments and the lack of public markets for privately held investments
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	there is greater risk of loss than is the case with traditional investment securities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	We do not choose investments based on a strategy of diversification. We also do not rebalance the portfolio should one of our portfolio companies increase in value substantially relative to the rest of the portfolio
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Therefore, the value of our portfolio may be more vulnerable to events affecting a single sector, industry or portfolio company and, therefore, may be subject to greater volatility than a company that follows a diversification strategy
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Because there is typically no public or readily-ascertainable market for our interests in the small privately-held companies in which we invest, the valuation of those securities is determined in good faith by the Valuation Committee, comprised of all members of the Board who are not &#8220;interested persons&#8221; of the Company, as such term is defined in Section 2(a)(19) of the 1940 Act, in accordance with our Valuation Procedures and is subject to significant estimates and judgments. The determined value of the securities in our portfolio may differ significantly from the values that would be placed on these securities if a ready market for the securities existed.&#160; Any changes in valuation are recorded in our Statement of Operations as &#8220;Net increase (decrease) in unrealized appreciation on investments.&#8221;&#160; Changes in valuation of any of our investments in privately-held companies from one period to another may be volatile.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	The Board may, from time to time, engage an independent valuation firm to provide it with valuation assistance with respect to certain of our portfolio investments. The Company intends to continue to engage an independent valuation firm to provide us with assistance regarding our determination of the fair value of select portfolio investments each quarter unless directed by the Board to cancel such valuation services. The scope of the services rendered by an independent valuation firm is at the discretion of the Board. The Board is ultimately and solely responsible for determining the fair value of the Company&#8217;s investments in good faith.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	With respect to investments for which market quotations are not readily available or when such market quotations are deemed not to represent fair value, the Board has approved a multi-step valuation process to be followed each quarter, as described below:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="833D77A843BD4CEF8AC87351D1F792A0" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	(1)
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	each quarter the valuation process begins with each portfolio company or investment being initially valued by the Adviser Valuation Committee or the independent valuation firm;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="0B1716869193436E9F39FDA46CD488CB" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	(2)
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	the Valuation Committee of the Board on a quarterly basis reviews the preliminary valuation of the Adviser Valuation Committee and that of the independent valuation firms and makes the fair value determination, in good faith, based on the valuation recommendations of the Adviser Valuation Committee and the independent valuation firms; and
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="5367449C973541D1AF857584E7E5E554" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	(3)
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	at each quarterly Board meeting, the Board considers the valuations recommended by the Adviser Valuation Committee and the independent valuation firms that were previously submitted to the Valuation Committee of the Board and ratifies the fair value determinations made by the Valuation Committee of the Board.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 11PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	54
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 1PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #555555; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #555555" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage58"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Firsthand Technology Value Fund, Inc.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Notes to Financial Statements - continued
</DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	DECEMBER 31, 2015
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	NOTE 4. INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT FEE
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	The Company has entered into an investment management agreement (the &#8220;Investment Management Agreement&#8221;) with Firsthand Capital Management
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	Inc.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	which was previously known as SiVest Group
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	Inc
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	(&#8220;FCM&#8221; or the &#8220;Adviser&#8221;)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	pursuant to which the Company will pay FCM a fee for providing investment management services consisting of two components&#8212;a base management fee and an incentive fee.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	The base management fee will be calculated at an annual rate of 2.00% of our gross assets.&#160; For services rendered under the Investment Management Agreement, the base management fee will be payable quarterly in arrears. The base management fee will be calculated based on the average of (1) the value of our gross assets at the end of the current calendar quarter and (2) the value of the Company&#8217;s gross assets at the end of the preceding calendar quarter; and will be appropriately adjusted for any share issuances or repurchases during the current calendar quarter.&#160; Base management fees for any partial month or quarter will be pro-rated.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	The incentive fee is determined and payable in arrears as of the end of each calendar year (or upon termination of the Investment Management Agreement, as of the termination date), commencing on April 15, 2011, and equals 20% of the Company&#8217;s realized capital gains, if any, on a cumulative basis from inception through the end of each calendar year, computed net of all realized capital losses and unrealized capital depreciation on a cumulative basis, less the aggregate amount of any previously paid incentive fees, provided that the incentive fee determined as of December 31, 2015, will be calculated for a period of shorter than twelve calendar months to take into account any realized gains computed net of all realized capital losses and unrealized capital depreciation from inception. As of December 31, 2015, there was an incentive fee expensed for $(2,478,204). As of December 31, 2014, there was an incentive fee expensed for $5,405,459.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	NOTE 5. DEBT
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	The Company currently has no plan to use leverage and does not have any significant outstanding debt obligations (other than normal operating expense accruals).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	NOTE 6. FAIR VALUE
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Securities traded on stock exchanges, or quoted by NASDAQ, are valued according to the NASDAQ Stock Market, Inc. (&#8220;NASDAQ&#8221;) official closing price, if applicable, or at their last reported sale price as of the close of trading on the New York Stock Exchange (&#8220;NYSE&#8221;) (normally 4:00 P.M. Eastern Time).&#160; If a security is not traded that day, the security will be valued at its most recent bid price.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Securities traded in the over-the-counter market, but not quoted by NASDAQ, are valued at the last sale price (or, if the last sale price is not readily available, at the most recent closing bid price as quoted by brokers that make markets in the securities) at the close of trading on the NYSE.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Securities traded both in the over-the-counter market and on a stock exchange are valued according to the broadest and most representative market.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Securities and other assets that do not have market quotations readily available are valued at their fair value as determined in good faith by the Board of Directors of the Company (the &#8220;Board&#8221;) in accordance with the Valuation Procedures adopted by the Valuation Committee, a committee of the Board.
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 11PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	55
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 1PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #555555; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #555555" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage59"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Firsthand Technology Value Fund, Inc.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Notes to Financial Statements - continued
</DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	DECEMBER 31, 2015
</FONT>
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	In pricing illiquid, privately placed securities, the Board of Directors is responsible for (1) determining overall valuation guidelines and (2) ensuring that the investments of the Company are valued within the prescribed guidelines.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	The Valuation Committee, comprised of all of the independent Board members, is responsible for determining the valuation of the Company&#8217;s assets within the guidelines established by the Board of Directors. The Valuation Committee receives information and recommendations from the Adviser and an independent valuation firm.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	The values assigned to these investments are based on available information and do not necessarily represent amounts that might ultimately be realized when that investment is sold
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	as such amounts depend on future circumstances and cannot reasonably be determined until the individual investments are actually liquidated or become readily marketable.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	APPROACHES TO DETERMINING FAIR VALUE.
</FONT>
</FONT>
	GAAP defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date (exit price).&#160; In effect, GAAP applies fair value terminology to all valuations whereas the 1940 Act applies market value terminology to readily marketable assets and fair value terminology to other assets.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	The main approaches to measuring fair value utilized are the market approach, the income approach, and the asset-based approach. The choice of which approach to use in a particular situation depends on the specific facts and circumstances associated with the company, as well as the purpose for which the valuation analysis is being conducted.&#160; Firsthand and the independent valuation firm rely primarily on the market and income approaches. We also considered the asset-based approach in our analysis because certain of the portfolio companies do not have substantial operating earnings relative to the value of their underlying assets.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<TABLE ID="8D42AE48FEAC413894E16838E6C73028" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Market Approach (M): The market approach uses prices and other relevant information generated by market transactions involving identical or comparable assets or liabilities.&#160; For example, the market approach often uses market multiples derived from a set of comparables.&#160; Multiples might lie in ranges with a different multiple for each comparable. The selection of where within the range each appropriate multiple falls requires the use of judgment in considering factors specific to the measurement (qualitative and quantitative).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<TABLE ID="726F08DBD089441A9D1F0DC0DE03CCAC" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Income Approach (I): The income approach uses valuation techniques to convert future amounts (for example, cash flows or earnings) to a single present value amount (discounted). The measurement is based on the value indicated by current market expectations about those future amounts. Those valuation techniques include present value techniques; option-pricing models, such as the Black-Scholes-Merton formula (a closed-form model) and a binomial model (a lattice model), which incorporate present value techniques; and the multi-period excess earnings method, which is used to measure the fair value of certain assets.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<TABLE ID="532AD536203E4647A46C087AD3B125A4" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Asset-Based Approach (A): The asset-based approach examines the value of a company&#8217;s assets net of its liabilities to derive a value for the equity holders.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 11PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	56
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 1PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #555555; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #555555" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage60"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Firsthand Technology Value Fund, Inc.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Notes to Financial Statements - continued
</DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	DECEMBER 31, 2015
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	FAIR VALUE MEASUREMENT.
</FONT>
</FONT>
	In accordance with the guidance from the Financial Accounting Standards Board on fair value measurements and disclosures under GAAP, the Company discloses the fair value of its investments in a hierarchy that prioritizes the inputs to valuation techniques used to measure the fair value. The hierarchy gives the highest priority to valuations based upon unadjusted quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities (Level 1 measurement) and the lowest priority to valuations based upon unobservable inputs that are significant to the valuation (Level 3 measurements).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	The guidance establishes three levels of the fair value hierarchy as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="6B13C59E075C4BC48C7DD3D76598DC75" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Level 1
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	-
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Unadjusted quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities that the Company has the ability to access at the date of measurement.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_21"></A>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="F3CDA5AF14FA4649842061576FE014C1" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Level 2
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Observable inputs other than quoted prices included in Level 1 that are observable for the asset or liability, either directly or indirectly
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	These inputs may include quoted prices for the identical instrument in an inactive market, prices for similar instruments in an active or inactive market, interest rates, prepayment speeds, credit risks, yield curves, default rates, and similar data.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="9E3CC50B0D7A4E8F9FBCAC45111D5506" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Level 3
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Unobservable inputs for the asset or liability, to the extent relevant observable inputs are not available, representing the Company&#8217;s own assumptions about the assumptions a market participant would use in valuing the asset or liability based on the best information available.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	The availability of observable inputs can vary from security to security and is affected by a wide variety of factors, including, for example, the type of security, whether the security is new and not yet established in the marketplace, the liquidity of markets, and other characteristics particular to the security
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	To the extent that valuation is based on models or inputs that are less observable or unobservable in the market, the determination of fair value requires more judgment.&#160; Accordingly, the degree of judgment exercised in determining fair value is greatest for instruments categorized in Level 3.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	The inputs used to measure fair value may fall into different levels of the fair value hierarchy.&#160; In such cases, for disclosure purposes, the level in the fair value hierarchy within which the fair value measurement falls in its entirety, is determined based on the lowest level input that is significant to the fair value measurement in its entirety
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 11PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	57
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">

</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage61"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Firsthand Technology Value Fund, Inc.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	The inputs or methodology used for valuing securities are not necessarily an indication of the risk associated with investing in those securities. The following is a summary of the inputs used to value the Company&#8217;s net assets as of December 31, 2015:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

</TD>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 55%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #DCDCDC" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Advanced Materials
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #DCDCDC" VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	At the end of each calendar quarter, management evaluates the Level 2 and Level 3 assets and liabilities for changes in liquidity, including but not limited to: whether a broker is willing to execute at the quoted price, the depth and consistency of prices from third party services, and the existence of contemporaneous, observable trades in the market. Additionally, management evaluates the Level 1 and Level 2 assets and liabilities on a quarterly basis for changes in listings or delistings on national exchanges. Transfers in and out of the levels are recognized at the value at the end of the period. There were no transfers between Levels 1 and 2 as of December 31, 2015.
</DIV>

<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	At the end of each calendar quarter, management evaluates the Level 2 and Level 3 assets and liabilities for changes in liquidity, including but not limited to: whether a broker is willing to execute at the quoted price, the depth and consistency of prices from third party services, and the existence of contemporaneous, observable trades in the market. Additionally, management evaluates the Level 1 and Level 2 assets and liabilities on a quarterly basis for changes in listings or delistings on national exchanges. Transfers in and out of the levels are recognized at the value at the end of the period. There were no transfers between Levels 1 and 2 as of December 31, 2014.
</DIV>
</DIV>

	Years to Expiration
</DIV>

</DIV>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	NOTE 7.&#160; FEDERAL INCOME TAXES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	The Company has elected, and intends to qualify annually, for the special tax treatment afforded regulated investment companies under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the &#8220;Code&#8221;).&#160; As provided in the Code, in any fiscal year in which a BDC so qualifies and distributes at least 90% of its taxable net income, the BDC (but not the shareholders) will be relieved of federal income tax on the income distributed.&#160; Accordingly, no provision for income taxes has been made.&#160; To avoid imposition of the excise tax applicable to regulated investment companies, the Company intends to declare as dividends in each calendar year at least 98% of its net investment income (earned during the calendar year) and 98.2% of its net realized capital gains (earned during the 12 months ended October 31) plus undistributed amounts, if any, from prior years.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	The reorganization described in Note 1 (the formation of FVI as a fully owned subsidiary for investment activities) was structured to avoid any adverse tax consequences for the Company and its shareholders. The Company&#8217;s engaging in investment activities through FVI does not, in our view, jeopardize the Company&#8217;s ability to continue to qualify as a RIC under the Code.
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 11PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	64
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX" VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</TD>

	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	NOTE 9.&#160; SHARE BUYBACK/TENDER OFFER
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	SHARE BUYBACK
</FONT>
	. In connection with our agreement with a shareholder, we agreed to establish an open-market purchase program to purchase up to $10 million of our common stock during certain periods in 2014 in which the market price of the common stock was below our NAV; On December 5, 2014, we completed the open market purchase program offer after reaching its $10 million goal. A total of 509,859 shares were purchased in the buyback at an average price of approximately $19.61 per share.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	TENDER OFFER
</FONT>
	. In connection with our agreement with a shareholder, we agreed to commence an issuer tender offer for up to $20 million of our shares of common stock at a purchase price per share equal to 95% of the Fund&#8217;s net asset value per share (&#8220;NAV&#8221;) as of the close of ordinary trading on the NASDAQ Global Market on December 31, 2014 (the &#8220;Offer&#8221;). On December 22, 2014, the Fund commenced a tender offer to purchase up to $20 million of its issued and outstanding common shares for cash at a price per share equal to 95% of the NAV determined on December 31, 2014 ($23.2702 per share). The tender offer, which expired on January 22, 2015 at 12:00 midnight, New York City time, was oversubscribed. Because the number of shares tendered exceeded the maximum amount of its offer, the Fund purchased shares from tendering shareholders on a pro-rata basis based on the number of shares properly tendered. Of the 5,044,728 shares properly tendered, the Fund purchased 859,468 shares of common stock pursuant to the tender offer.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	NOTE 10.&#160; INVESTMENTS IN AFFILIATES AND CONTROLLED INVESTMENTS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Under the 1940 Act, the Company is required to identify investments where it owns greater than 5% (but less than 25%) of the portfolio company&#8217;s outstanding voting shares as an affiliate of the Company. Also, under the 1940 Act, the Company is required to identify investments where it owns greater than 25% of the portfolio company&#8217;s outstanding voting shares as a controlled investment of the Company. A summary of the Company&#8217;s investments in affiliates and controlled investments for the period from December 31, 2014, through December 31, 2015, is noted below:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	As of December 31, 2015, Kevin Landis represents the Company and sits on the board of directors of Hera Systems, Inc.; Hiku Labs, Inc.; IntraOp Medical Corp.; Phunware, Inc.; Pivotal Systems, Inc.; Silicon Genesis Corporation; Telepathy Investors, Inc.; QMAT, Inc.; Vufine, Inc.; and Wrightspeed, Inc.&#160; Serving on boards of directors of portfolio companies may cause conflicts of interest. The Adviser has adopted various procedures to ensure that the Company will not be unfavorably affected by these potential conflicts.

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	As of December 31, 2015, Kevin Landis represents the Company and sits on the board of directors of Hera Systems, Inc.; Hiku Labs, Inc.; IntraOp Medical Corp.; Phunware, Inc.; Pivotal Systems, Inc.; Silicon Genesis Corporation; Telepathy Investors, Inc.; QMAT, Inc.; Vufine, Inc.; and Wrightspeed, Inc. Serving on boards of directors of portfolio companies may cause conflicts of interest. The Adviser has adopted various procedures to ensure that the Company will not be unfavorably affected by these potential conflicts.

<EFX_SUBSEQUENT_EVENTS>
<A NAME="FIS_SUBSEQUENT_EVENTS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	NOTE 11. SUBSEQUENT EVENTS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	On January 7, 2016, Hudson&#8217;s Bay Company announced that it had entered into a definitive agreement to purchase Gilt Groupe Holdings, Inc. for $250 million in cash. On February 1, 2016, the company announced that the transaction had been completed. The Fund currently expects to receive approximately $1.7514 per share of common stock it holds, and it may receive additional consideration at a later date if certain conditions are met.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	On February 1, 2016, Telenor Group announced that it had entered into a definitive agreement to acquire approximately 95% of Tapad, Inc. for approximately $360 million in cash, subject to certain conditions. The transaction is expected to close prior to the end of first quarter 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	The Adviser has evaluated events and transactions for potential recognition or disclosure and determined that there were no additional material events that would require additional disclosure through the date the financial statements were issued.
</DIV>

<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Item 9A. CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	DISCLOSURE CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer performed an evaluation of the effectiveness of our disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended) as of December 31, 2015 and, based on that evaluation, have concluded that the disclosure controls and procedures are effective.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	REPORT OF MANAGEMENT ON INTERNAL CONTROL OVER FINANCIAL REPORTING
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Our management is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Rules 13a-15(f ) and 15d-15(f ) of the Exchange Act). Internal control over financial reporting is a process designed by, or under the supervision of, our principal executive and financial officer
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	or persons performing similar functions, and effected by our board of directors, management, and other personnel, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles and includes those policies and procedures that (i) pertain to the maintenance of records that in reasonable detail accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of our assets; (ii) provide reasonable assurance that the transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that our receipts and expenditures are being made only in accordance with authorizations of our management and our directors; and (iii) provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use or disposition of our assets that could have a material effect on the consolidated financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 11PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	71
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 1PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #555555; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #555555" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage75"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Our management evaluated as of December 31
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	2015 the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting using the criteria set forth by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO) in Internal Control &#8212; Integrated Framework
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Based on this evaluation
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	our management concluded that our internal control over financial reporting was effective as of December 31
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	2015
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Our independent registered public accounting firm
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	Tait
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	Weller &amp; Baker LLP
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	issued a report on the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting as of December 31
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	2015
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	which appears on page 39 herein.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	INHERENT LIMITATIONS OF EFFECTIVENESS OF CONTROLS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Our management, including our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	do not expect that our disclosure controls and procedures or our internal control over financial reporting will prevent all errors and all fraud. A control system, no matter how well conceived and operated, can provide only reasonable, not absolute, assurance that the objectives of the control system are met. Further, the benefits of controls must be considered relative to their costs. Because of the inherent limitations in all control systems, no evaluation of controls can provide absolute assurance that all control issues and instances of fraud, if any, have been detected. These inherent limitations include the realities that judgments in decision-making can be faulty, and that breakdowns can occur because of simple errors or mistakes. Additionally, controls can be circumvented by the individual acts of some persons, by collusion of two or more people or by management override of the control. The design of any system of controls is also based in part upon certain assumptions about the likelihood of future events, and there can be no assurance that any design will succeed in achieving its stated goals under all potential future conditions. Projections of any evaluation of controls effectiveness to future periods are subject to risks. Over time, controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions or deterioration in the degree of compliance with policies or procedures.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	CHANGES IN INTERNAL CONTROL OVER FINANCIAL REPORTING
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	There have been no changes in our internal control over financial reporting that occurred during our fourth quarter ended December
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	31
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	2015 that have materially affected
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	or are reasonably likely to materially affect
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	our internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>

</DIV>
<EFX_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS>
<A NAME="FIS_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Item 10. DIRECTORS, EXECUTIVES OFFICERS AND CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Reference is made to the information with respect to &#8220;Directors and Executive officers of the Registrant&#8221; to be contained in the Company&#8217;s proxy statement to be filed with the SEC, in connection with the Company&#8217;s annual meeting of shareholders to be held in 2016 (the &#8220;2016 Proxy Statement&#8221;), which information is incorporated herein by reference.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	The Company has adopted a code of ethics that applies to the Company&#8217;s chief executive officer
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	a copy of which is posted on our website http://www.firsthandtvf.com.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Our CEO certifies the accuracy of the financial statements contained in our periodic reports, and so certified in this Form 10-K through the filing of Section 302 certifications as exhibits to this Form 10-K.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 requires the Company&#8217;s officers and directors, and persons who own more than ten percent of a registered class of the Company&#8217;s equity securities, to file with the Securities and Exchange Commission and the Nasdaq Stock Market reports of ownership of the Company&#8217;s securities and changes in reported ownership. Officers, directors and greater than ten percent shareholders are required by SEC rules to furnish the Company with copies of all Section 16(a) reports they file.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Based solely on a review of the reports furnished to the Company, or written representations from reporting persons that all reportable transaction were reported, the Company believes that during the fiscal year ended December 31, 2015 the Company&#8217;s officers, directors and greater than ten percent owners timely filed all reports they were required to file under Section 16(a).
</DIV>
</DIV>

	Who is providing this notice?
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 2PX SOLID; WIDTH: 85%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID">

	Firsthand Technology Value Fund, Inc. is a publically traded venture capital fund, listed on NASDAQ, that is a business development company under the Investment Company Act of 1940
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.

	These measures include computer safeguards and secured files and buildings.

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	open an account or deposit money
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 32.64%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: #000000 2PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Why can&#8217;t I limit all sharing?
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 2PX SOLID; WIDTH: 67.36%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Federal law gives you the right to limit only
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	&#9658;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	sharing for affiliates&#8217; everyday business purposes&#8212;information about your creditworthiness
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	&#9658;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	affiliates from using your information to market to you
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	&#9658;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	sharing for nonaffiliates to market to you
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	State laws and individual companies may give you additional rights to limit sharing.
</DIV>

<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 11PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 11PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 1PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #555555; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #555555" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage80"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	LETTER TO SHAREHOLDERS
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	-
</FONT>
	CONTINUED FROM INSIDE FRONT COVER
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	In November, IntraOp Medical announced that more than 15,000 patients worldwide have now been treated with the company&#8217;s Mobetron device. Earlier in the year, a leading industry journal, Radiation Oncology, published the results of a clinical study of Japanese cancer patients treated with Mobetron. The results of the 5-year study of 32 breast cancer patients showed that there were zero instances of recurrence or metastasis.&#160; It is tricky to draw too many conclusions from 32 patients, but zero is a great number
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	We remain very excited about the prospects for IntraOp and are working diligently with management to increase the visibility of the company&#8217;s technology
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	EXCITEMENT IN EARLY-STAGE INVESTMENTS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Several of our most recent investments have been in early-stage companies. Despite their relative youth, some are already in the news. In July
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
	Vufine completed a successful Kickstarter campaign for its high-definition, wearable display, which we see as a lower-cost, more focused solution than Google Glass. After setting a goal of raising $50,000 in 30 days, the company ended up bringing in
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	$241,111 from 1,466 backers.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	In November, Hiku announced its second-generation grocery scanner and integration with both Walmart and Peapod to enable shoppers to use the device to place orders directly with these merchants&#8217; online grocery services. We began investing in Hiku in September 2014 and are excited that this small company is already making waves in the grocery business.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Late in the year, Hera Systems announced plans to launch nine high-resolution imaging satellites in 2016. The company subsequently announced that it has entered into a licensing agreement with NASA Ames Research Center, which will enable Hera to speed development of its next-generation spacecraft. The company is targeting government and enterprise customers with its full-color imaging and video capability
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	THE ROAD AHEAD
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	As you are probably aware, the maturing of a typical private technology company takes many years. It took Sunrun nearly 9 years to get to IPO from its founding in January 2007. In between the time of investment and an exit, the hard work of guiding each company through the process of growth dominates our efforts. Challenges being tackled often include fundraising, arranging strategic partnerships, developing go-to-market strategies, and attracting and retaining top talent. While the results of these efforts are not usually reflected in a steadily climbing valuation, progress is quietly being made nonetheless.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	All of this is to say that not every year will be loaded with profitable exits. There will be good years, there will be quiet years, and there will be not-so-good years. In hindsight, 2015 was a quiet year
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
	Venture investing requires patience, but as we survey our portfolio, we are encouraged by the number of pending exits in the pipeline and look forward to a good year in 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	While we are very excited about the prospects of our portfolio companies, our enthusiasm is clearly not shared by the market, judging by SVVC&#8217;s persistent discount to NAV. I believe the market is grossly misjudging the value of our portfolio, and I have put my money where my mouth is. I personally made a significant investment in SVVC stock during 2015, and anticipate being a buyer in 2016 as well. We continue to examine and consider other ways to deliver value to shareholders and will do what we think is best for the long-term investors in our fund.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Finally, we wish to thank you for entrusting your investment dollars to us. We believe the future is bright, and we&#8217;re working hard every day to make good investments in some of the most exciting technology companies in the world.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Sincerely
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	,
</FONT>
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	/s/ Kevin Landis
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Kevin Landis
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	CEO and President
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	Firsthand Technology Value Fund, Inc.
</DIV>

<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_31"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">

<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CERTIFICATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	I, Kevin Landis, Chief Executive Officer, certify that:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 24.45PT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	1. I have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of Firsthand Technology Value Find, Inc. (the &#8220;registrant&#8221;) for the fiscal year ended December&#160;31, 2015;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 24.45PT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	2. Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 24.45PT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	3. Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 24.45PT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	4. The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 48.95PT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	a) Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 48.95PT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	b) Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 48.95PT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	c) Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 48.95PT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	d) Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#8217;s fourth fiscal quarter that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 24.45PT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	5. The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee of registrant&#8217;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 48.95PT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	a) All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 48.95PT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	b) Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	&#160;

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>

	&#160;
</DIV>

	&#160;

	4. The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:

	&#160;

	b) Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</DIV>

</DIV>

<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION_2"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 11PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	In connection with the accompanying Annual Report on Form 10-K of Firsthand Technology Value Fund, Inc. (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) for the fiscal year ended December&#160;31, 2014 as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the &#8220;Report&#8221;), I, Kevin Landis, Chief Executive Officer of the Company, certify, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. &#167;1350, as adopted pursuant to &#167;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, to the best of my knowledge, that:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 24.45PT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	(1) the Report fully complies with the requirements of Section&#160;13(a) or Section&#160;15(d), as applicable, of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended; and
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 24.45PT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	(2) the information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 24.45PT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">

	Date: March&#160;15, 2016
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">

	In connection with the accompanying Annual Report on Form 10-K of Firsthand Technology Value Fund, Inc.
